properties.text:
Welcome to Blood & Iron, an HQM adventure map.

You will find that Blood & Iron is very different from vanilla, to the extent that it could be considered a total conversion. Even the mods we use have been altered to fit with the theme, so don't feel bad if you're a little lost.

This guide is meant to help you familiarize yourself with the pack, but first things first: you need to get to safety.

In your inventory you'll see a book like this:

This is your cogitator, or computer for those not familiar with the 40k universe. It contains information regarding most of your quests and also tracks things like your party and reputation with certain factions.

The first page you see when you open it is the intro page. You can read that over once you get to safety, as well. For now you need to look at the bottom left side of the book and click "Click here to start".

The next section lists stats on quests, which you can also look at later. Ignore that for now and click on the middle left of the page where it says "Click to show quests".

You should now see a list of various chapters on the left and a brief description of the chapters and summary of their quests on the right.

Right now you need to click on "Forbidden Planet", which is the quest line that starts you off. It is HIGHLY recomended to play through Forbidden Planet, as the rewards you get will keep you alive through the early game.

Once you have "Forbidden Planet" selected, go ahead and hit the "Open" button at the bottom of the right page.

You should now see a screen like the on on your right. This is the listing of quests that you can see so far, but keep in mind that more will be unlocked as you progress.

Click on the first quest you see, the one that looks like a beer bottle, and turn to the next page of this guide.

You are now viewing the details for this quest. Quests have many different objectives which are mostly explained in the various text boxes you can see. 

This quest is a submit quest, which means you need to have the item it's asking for in your inventory. That's not all though, once you have the item, you have to hit the "Manual submit" button to turn it in, completing the quest.

Once you do so you will be able to claim your reward. For this quest you have the option to choose between beer and water as well as your normal rewards. You must make a choice before you can claim the rewards. I suggest water.

Once you have claimed your reward, it's time to move on to the next quest.

Keep in mind that you don't always HAVE to claim your reward. You can wait until later if you want.

Completing the first quest opens the second quest, a location quest. Location quests require you go to certain coordinates. Once you get to those coordinates the quest will be completed.

Another important bit of info to remember is that there is no prompt when a quest is completed or new quests appear. You just have to keep an eye on your cogitator.

"Forbidden Planet"s opening quests should be completed with haste. Blood & Iron is filled with dangers that make vanilla pale in comparison. Most of those dangers come at night, so above all try not to get stuck outside at night.

Once you get to the Ad-mech bunker you can calm down a little. You have reached relative safety and it's probably time for you to start building up a base.

One other point of order before we conclude this starter guide. Some quests are considered bonus quests. They will not show up until they are completed, and you will not know ahead of time what it

takes to complete them. This is intentional. By exploring the map you will likely stumble upon peculiar sites. Exploring these sites will sometimes complete an optional quest. 

Don't worry about missing the optional quests, they are not necessary, just helpful. You should keep them in mind when traveling, though, as you never know when one will trigger.

Now you know what you have to do, so what are you waiting for?
